TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
;\_;7

What a great ending to a great story ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

"You must spread some reputation around before you can give it to Kuzzter again."

Dangit!

I cracked up at "Le ding"

Thanks again for a great and very-well-illustrated story. I love the work you put into the sets, like the courtroom; they really add to the experience

Great ending to a great story. Thank you for lots and lots of good reading, emotions and inspiring moments.

![tumblr_lt23ujVy4p1r2xeano1_500.jpg](https://41.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_lt23ujVy4p1r2xeano1_500.jpg)

Slow clap all around. Well done, sir!

Rune. Now for the next one! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> \*applause\*

Same here: \*applause\* claps hands while holding a cup coffee, again![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

\*clap\* That was a magnificent ending. 

I hope the ship they're testing will one day be used for a mission to Dres.

Brilliant. This has been so amazing.

Is this the end of Eve: Order Zero?
next stop: Jool?

such a nice ending to a nice story!! Next stop: The Joolian System!(?) I expect it would be something similar in style to DOB, which was really awesome itself. Or perhaps is the Admiral working with the Agency with the 'ugly' SSTO(I expect that was a red herring)?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-15T14:27:27Z" title="11/15/2015 02:27  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 15, 2015</time> by PotentiallyHabitable578**

Once again we come to the close of another Kerbfleet tale.

And once again I will say that it has been a privilege, a great pleasure, uncountable laughs, and an absolute joy (even with some tears) to accompany you and our brave kerbonauts on this amazing voyage.

Thanks cannot begin to convey my gratitude for the truly great contribution that these stories make to our community and (dare I say it?) our culture (kulture?).

Kerbfleet forever!

Happy landings!

Why does *every* Jeb pic is see with him in the command chair has him with a grin that looks that came out of Dr Strangelove? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Anyway, slow clap \*111 ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

What's with the Dres Awareness thing?

I vote Laythe, by the way ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Why Dres Awareness? [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138726-Dres-Awareness-Show-Your-Support%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138726-Dres-Awareness-Show-Your-Support%21) is why. Read the backstory/beginning part.

To the Joolian system. Racing against the mirror universe to colonize the Vallhenge area to make sure the Mirrors don't colonize the Prime universe? Maybe the Kerbals will accidentally awaken the Deep Space Kraken of Bop, and the Krakens will invade?

Or maybe it will be a perfectly normal mission. As if!
DRES!! Ã¢â‚¬â€¹plz i beg

Dres!

We demand Dres love!

Thanks for this awesome read, Kuzzter (and also for DOB again). 

Brake your mast and sheets, and may you always have a handswith of water under your keel!

I , for myself, would like to see Moho. There is a certain Kerbfleet officer that is deathly afraid of the Mohole, so I guess that he has to face his fears ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I also would like to thank you for writing this, it has been a great source of entertainment for a while now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I also vote for Moho, if only for Sun-diving potential. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

You guys are Drescist!

Drescist (Dres-syst), Adjective

A term to describe those who will do anything in their power to stop themselves or others from visiting the lonely space potato known as Dres

Hey, haven't you heard the news? Dres is not alone for atleast 5 game versions ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) In fact it might be the planet in game with more company now ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

IMO, you should all... 

[first choice of words redacted]

... stop the unhelpful chatter and "demands" and let Kuzzter tell the story(s) *he* wants to tell. He's done a pretty good job of it so far.

> 
> IMO, you should all... 
> [first choice of words redacted]
> 
> ... stop the unhelpful chatter and "demands" and let Kuzzter tell the story(s) *he* wants to tell. He's done a pretty good job of it so far.

I know it isn't helping any more, but would we even be talking about Dres if not for these whiny demands?

Really appreciate all the kind words from everyone. Again, thank you! Your comments and participation help make this a lot of fun for me to do :)  

[quote name='Endersmens']Good ending to the story. Might I suggest the next part of the mission be focused on filing up the Science Libraries? You've filled the tech tree, now fill the science library! Get a report from every body or something. [I]Something![/I] :D[/QUOTE]  

I've thought that might be a nice personal goal, but I'm not sure I would want to fill up a lot of comic pages doing "gotta catch 'em all"...  

[quote name='RAINCRAFTER']And that's it. Until Kuzzter feels like starting all over, that's the end. Kerbfleet has been milked for all of it's worth across this plot-line[/QUOTE]  

Across this particular plotline, yes--but I might have a few more things to say about some things, and more stories to tell :)  

[quote name='Deddly']Thanks again for a great and very-well-illustrated story. I love the work you put into the sets, like the courtroom; they really add to the experience[/QUOTE]  

I really appreciate you saying that. At some point this became more than a mission report for me--I had a story to tell besides just "I landed this cool ship and got xxxx science points!" Doing the animation poses and building sets etc became necessary to do it right, and it is a lot of extra non-gameplaying work, so thank you for noticing :D   

[quote name='DMSP']Is this the end of Eve: Order Zero?[/QUOTE]  

Yes and no. There will still be a Postlude, but that Postlude could stand alone or even be considered a prologue for the next story. Think of it this way: I rolled the 'credits' in the last few pages, and this is the bonus scene for anyone who sticks around in the theater to the end :)  

[quote name='PotentiallyHabitable578']such a nice ending to a nice story!! Next stop: The Joolian System!(?) I expect it would be something similar in style to DOB, which was really awesome itself. Or perhaps is the Admiral working with the Agency with the 'ugly' SSTO(I expect that was a red herring)?[/QUOTE]  

Thanks, there are a lot of ways this can go next and yeah, maybe it would be a nice break to go back to a straight-up mission report without so much Deep Meaning. I can say this; you will see the 'ugly SSTO' again, or something like it. Or then again maybe you won't ;)  

[quote name='Starhawk']Thanks cannot begin to convey my gratitude for the truly great contribution that these stories make to our community and (dare I say it?) our culture (kulture?). Kerbfleet forever![/QUOTE]  

Really appreciate all you've done hanging in there with me along the way Starhawk--contributing my ideas to the general canon has always been a goal of mine, and if the appearance of certain of my memes in certain other works is any indication, I guess I've been successful :) As I've said many times, I wouldn't be doing ANY of this without you guys, the conversation on this thread is a real treat and a privilege to be a part of.  

[quote name='GregroxMun']To the Joolian system. Racing against the mirror universe to colonize the Vallhenge area to make sure the Mirrors don't colonize the Prime universe? Maybe the Kerbals will accidentally awaken the Deep Space Kraken of Bop, and the Krakens will invade?  

Or maybe it will be a perfectly normal mission. As if![/QUOTE]  

As if, indeed! In a completely unrelated note, do you make planet textures? Asking for a friend :)  

[quote name='r\_rolo1']I , for myself, would like to see Moho. There is a certain Kerbfleet officer that is deathly afraid of the Mohole, so I guess that he has to face his fears ;)[/QUOTE]  

Hey, I actually had not thought of that! Hm. HMMMMM...  

[quote name='Commander Zoom']IMO, you should all...   

[first choice of words redacted]  

... stop the unhelpful chatter and "demands" and let Kuzzter tell the story(s) [I]he[/I] wants to tell. He's done a pretty good job of it so far.[/QUOTE]  

Right, about that. I have a story to tell, and I'm gonna tell it. It's still forming, and maybe it won't be as epic as an Eve rescue, or maybe it will. But my own counsel will I keep on where that story takes place. :)

Did I hear... counsel? :cool:  

Wonderful story, Kuzzter. I enjoyed every moment of it. If you ever need another lawyer, well, I'm your Kerb!
